p: All bacterial isolates had the efficacy to grow in up to 200 mM salt stress, except for Acinetobacter radiresistens and Burkholderia cepacia, which could be grown up to 150 mM NaCl. The phenomenon of salt stress can help plants that are sensitive to saltiness if these bacterial endophytes are used as bio-inoculants. The potentiality of these endophytic bacteria to ameliorate salt stress can be attributed to several strategies including osmoprotectant accumulation in their cytoplasm.
